page.title: 09CROPS OF GREENHALGH/ROSEACRE
page.content: Some farms in the D block have land under the plough. Cash crops of wheat, barley and potatoes are grown. Trial crops of protein peas and oil seed rape are grown. World imbalance of food has meant overproduction of dairy products and corn. Farmers must experiment with alternative crops for cash and cattle feed. Rents are high up to Â£160 per hectare rising every third year. About half the farms are tenanted. Milk is on a quota system reducing average turnover on dairy farms by thousands of pounds. Hedges remain to confine animals. Spraying is used where intensive management is needed. Larger units are becoming the norm. There is one horticultural unit which comprises glass houses and market garden of 1.5 - 2.0 hectares where salad crops, pot plants and cut flowers are grown.
